text: Kenneth Malcolm Wharram (July 2, 1933 - January 10, 2017) was a retired professional ice hockey right winger who played 14 seasons in the National Hockey League. He played for the Chicago Black Hawks from 1951 through 1952 and again from 1958 until he retired in 1969. He won a Stanley Cup in 1961. He was born in North Bay, Ontario. Wharram died on January 10, 2017 from heart failure in North Bay, Ontario, aged 83.Local Stanley Cup Champion passes away ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1933 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey right wingers Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:Lady Byng Memorial Trophy winners Category:Sportspeople from Ontario
title: Kenny Wharram
